articles.author: Supantha Mukherjee
articles.description: The EU Commission on Wednesday designated 22 services of six major tech companies as "gatekeepers" of online services providing messaging to video sharing in its latest crackdown on Big Tech.
articles.title: Big Tech's core businesses face overhaul under EU tech rules

articles.author: Steve Scherer, David Ljunggren
articles.description: The Bank of Canada on Wednesday is expected to keep rates on hold at a 22-year high of 5% after the economy unexpectedly shrank in the second quarter, analysts said.
articles.title: Bank of Canada seen holding rates steady after economy shrank in Q2

articles.author: M. Sriram, Aditya Kalra
articles.description: Tata Group's consumer unit is in talks to buy at least 51% of popular Indian snack food maker Haldiram's but is not comfortable with the $10 billion valuation sought, two people briefed on the matter said.
articles.title: Exclusive: India's Tata seeks control of Haldiram's, snack maker wants $10 bln valuation

articles.author: David Kirton, Max Cherney
articles.description: Huawei Technologies' breakthrough in making an advanced chip underscores China's determination and capacity for fighting back against U.S. sanctions, but the efforts are likely very costly and could prompt Washington to tighten curbs, analysts said.
articles.title: Huawei's new chip breakthrough likely to trigger closer US scrutiny, analysts say

articles.author: Arathy Somasekhar
articles.description: Oil prices ticked up on Thursday, as markets worried about a supply shortage after Saudi Arabia and Russia extended their voluntary supply cuts to the end of the year.
articles.title: Oil prices edge higher on supply woes as Saudi, Russia extend output cuts

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: British construction firms suffered a sharp drop in orders in August, adding to concerns about a slowing economy amid rising interest rates, a survey showed on Wednesday.
articles.title: UK builders suffer sharp fall in orders as rates rise -PMI

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Russian mercenary Wagner Group is set to be proscribed as a terrorist organization by the British government, the interior ministry said on Wednesday.
articles.title: UK to declare Russia's Wagner a terrorist organisation

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Armenia said on Wednesday it would host a joint military exercise with the United States next week, a development that Russia said was cause for concern.
articles.title: Armenia to exercise with US troops next week, Russia voices concern

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Chinese Premier Li Qiang said on Wednesday it is important to avoid a "new Cold War" when dealing with conflicts between countries as world leaders gathered in Indonesia amid sharpening geopolitical rivalries across the Indo-Pacific region.
articles.title: China warns against 'new Cold War' at ASEAN summit
